author: Mike Masnick
description: Ctrl-Alt-Speech is a weekly podcast about the latest news in online speech, from Mike Masnick and Everything in Moderation‘s Ben Whitelaw. Subscribe now on Apple Podcasts, Overcast, Spotify, Pocket Casts, YouTube, or your podcast app of choice — or go straight to the RSS feed. In this week’s round-up of the latest news in online […]
title: Ctrl-Alt-Speech: The UK Wants Us To Ask Your Age Before You Listen

author: Mike Masnick
description: This story was originally published by ProPublica. Republished under a CC BY-NC-ND 3.0 license. The Internal Revenue Service is building a computer program that would give deportation officers unprecedented access to confidential tax data. ProPublica has obtained a blueprint of the system, which would create an “on demand” process allowing Immigration and Customs Enforcement to obtain the home addresses of […]
title: The IRS Is Building A Vast System To Share Millions Of Taxpayers’ Data With ICE

author: Tim Cushing
description: Even during the (relatively more sane) first Trump administration, it was clear there just weren’t enough dangerous criminals residing in this country illegally to back up Trump’s bloated, fact-free “invasion” claims. Statistics continually show migrants commit fewer crimes than American citizens while doing other useful things like paying taxes and providing an incredibly reliable workforce. […]
title: DHS Abandons Fighting Actual Crime To Focus All Of Its Attention On Undocumented Migrants

author: Mike Masnick
description: Over the last year or so I’ve seen a disturbing tendency in tech/startup/VC worlds to buy into the neoreactionary view that for startups to be successful they need to get on board the Trump train. Yes, there are the big name folks who everyone knows about and who didn’t really surprise anyone—Peter Thiel, Marc Andreessen, […]
title: Fascism For First Time Founders

author: Daily Deal
description: Learn Raspberry Pi and start building Amazon Alexa projects with The Complete Raspberry Pi and Alexa A-Z Bundle. Catered for all levels, these project-based courses will get you up and running with the basics of Pi, before escalating to full projects. Before you know it, you’ll be building a gaming system to play old Nintendo, […]
title: Daily Deal: The Complete Raspberry Pi And Alexa A-Z Bundle

author: Karl Bode
description: T-Mobile has long kissed the ass of the Trump regime. You might recall when the company wanted its competition-eroding merger with Sprint approved, it spent hundreds of thousands of dollars at Trump hotel properties. It hired Trump advisor Corey Lewandowski not long after he publicly mocked a child with Down Syndrome. It worked with Trump […]
title: T-Mobile Proud To Be More Racist In Exchange For Trump Merger(s) Approval

author: Mike Masnick
description: Earlier this year, I was a part of a CNN documentary, Twitter: Breaking the Bird, which gave memuch pause for reflection about the state of social media and how we got here. This year alonewe’ve witnessed an unprecedented wave of disruption across these platforms. Government workers, locked out of their jobs, struggled to organize securely. […]
title: We Deserve Better: A New Social Media Bill of Rights

author: Dark Helmet
description: We just talked about Ross Scott’s Stop Killing Games initiative, started last year, which has found new life recently due to an online back and forth with some gaming industry veterans. As a short primer, Scott’s campaign centers around game preservation and ownership, two topics we discuss here regularly. It’s not a complicated set of […]
title: ‘Stop Killing Games’ Finds An Ally In An EU Politician
